channel.title: gateway nyx log. portscan ?
channel.description:
on KVM Whonix-Gateway. Noticed nyx log like this:
> Blockquote [NOTICE] You configured a non-loopback address '10.152.152.10:9229' for HTTP TunnelPort. This allows everybody onyour local network to use your machine as a proxy. Make sure this is what you wanted. [3 duplicates hidden] [NOTICE] You configured a non-loopback address '10.152.152.10:9228' for HTTP TunnelPort. This allows everybody onyour local network to use your machine as a proxy. Make sure this is what you wanted. [3 duplicates hidden] [NOTICE] You configured a non-loopback address '10.152.152.10:9227' for HTTP TunnelPort. This allows everybody onyour local network to use your machine as a proxy. Make sure this is what you wanted. [3 duplicates hidden] [NOTICE] You configured a non-loopback address '10.152.152.10:9226' for HTTP TunnelPort. This allows everybody onyour local network to use your machine as a proxy. Make sure this is what you wanted. [3 duplicates hidden] [NOTICE] You configured a non-loopback address '10.152.152.10:9225' for HTTP TunnelPort. This allows everybody onyour local network to use your machine as a proxy. Make sure this is what you wanted. [3 duplicates hidden] [NOTICE] You configured a non-loopback address '10.152.152.10:9224' for HTTP TunnelPort. This allows everybody onyour local network to use your machine as a proxy. Make sure this is what you wanted. [3 duplicates hidden] [NOTICE] You configured a non-loopback address '10.152.152.10:9223' for HTTP TunnelPort. This allows everybody onyour local network to use your machine as a proxy. Make sure this is what you wanted. [3 duplicates hidden]
What's happening ? ports acceded 9229, 9228, 9227... like 100 of them in sequential order. Maybe someone portscan me ?
